isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE - REAR HVAC UNIT

step1.para: Under the vehicle, use clamping pliers to pinch the rubber section of the rear heater lines closed. Place the clamps several inches from the metal/rubber joint. Refer to Figure 53.
Place a suitable drain pan under the heater core connections.

note.para: It may be easier to disconnect the hoses in the following step if the rear AC/heater line hanger is loosened or removed.

step1.para: Disconnect the rubber hoses from the heater core tubes ( Figure 54). Allow coolant from heater core to drain into container.

figure.caption: Figure 53. Heater/AC Lines Clamped Under Cab
Figure 54. Rear A/C and Heater Line Connections

step1.para: Inside the cab, raise and support the lower bunk.
Remove the 2 screws securing the heater core cover (1, Figure 55). Remove the cover.

note.para: In the following step it may be easier to remove the clamp plate by raising the heater core slightly out of its cavity.

step1.para: Remove the clamp plate (3, Figure 55) securing the heater core inlet and outlet tubes. Disconnect the tubes from the core, and rotate them out of the way.
If necessary, remove the heater core inlet and outlet tubes (4, Figure 55).

If the heater core inlet and outlet tubes were removed; note the position of the foam spacer and seal (below the housing), then carefully install the heater core inlet and outlet tubes (4, Figure 55) and rotate them out of the way.

note.para: In the following step it may be easier to insert the inlet/outlet tubes by raising the heater core slightly out of its cavity.

step1.para: Using new O-rings, insert the heater core inlet and outlet tubes into the core and secure with the clamp plate.
Install heater core cover (1, Figure 55) and secure with 2 screws.
Under the cab, connect the heater core inlet/outlet hoses to the heater core tubes. Install or tighten the rear AC/heater line hanger ( Figure 54) if removed earlier.
Remove the clamping pliers used to pinch the heater lines closed.
Add coolant drained during removal, to the coolant system.
